title: PLUS F.C.
text:
PLUS Football Club () is a <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club of <a href="PLUS%20Expressways%20Berhad">PLUS Expressways Berhad</a>, the main toll highway operator company of the <a href="Malaysian%20Expressway%20System">Malaysian Expressway System</a>. The club currently plays in the fourth Division of <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>n football, the <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur%20League">Kuala Lumpur League</a>. Their home stadium is the <a href="MBPJ%20Stadium">MBPJ Stadium</a>, <a href="Kelana%20Jaya">Kelana Jaya</a>, <a href="Petaling%20Jaya">Petaling Jaya</a>, <a href="Selangor">Selangor</a>. Starts in an amateur KLFA Division 2 League in 2000. After 2 years be promoted to KLFA Division 1 League and become KLFA Cup champion in 2004 subsequently qualify to <a href="FAM%20Cup">FAM Cup</a> in 2005. Promoted to the 2nd Division of Malaysian league, <a href="Premier%20League%20Malaysia">Premier League Malaysia</a> in 2007 and a year later becomes Runner-Up of this division and automatically promoted to <a href="Super%20League%20Malaysia%202009">Super League Malaysia 2009</a> in 2009. The club finished a commendable 7th place in its first season of the <a href="Super%20League%20Malaysia">Super League Malaysia</a> and reached the quarter-finals stage of the 2009 <a href="Malaysia%20Cup">Malaysia Cup</a>.
PLUS FC withdrew from the <a href="2011%20Super%20League%20Malaysia">2011 Super League Malaysia</a> following a corporate exercise of PLUS Expressways. They were replaced by <a href="Harimau%20Muda%20A">Harimau Muda A</a> for the spot at the <a href="2011%20Super%20League%20Malaysia">2011 Super League Malaysia</a>.
PLUS FC came back in <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur%20League">Kuala Lumpur League</a> Division 1 in year 2013 and also want rejoin to the <a href="M-League">M-League</a> after 4 years hiatus.
